message.raw:
Removed unnecessary calls to Tab._update_error().

Since _update_error() also updates the tab icon, renamed it to
_update_error_and_tab_icon(), and renamed update_tab_icon_and_colour() to
set_tab_icon_and_colour() to differentiate it, since it is more about
setting the icon and colour rather than figuring out what the icon and colour
should be.
message.html:
Removed unnecessary calls to Tab._update_error().

Since _update_error() also updates the tab icon, renamed it to
_update_error_and_tab_icon(), and renamed update_tab_icon_and_colour() to
set_tab_icon_and_colour() to differentiate it, since it is more about
setting the icon and colour rather than figuring out what the icon and colour
should be.

setting the icon and colour rather than figuring out what the icon and colour
should be.

should be.

message.raw:
Remove timeout on polling second queue during experiment. Now, during an
experiment the loop will block for 0.5 seconds at a time waiting for the end
of the experiment, and then each loop it will also check without blocking if
there was an abort or restart.
message.html:
Remove timeout on polling second queue during experiment. Now, during an
experiment the loop will block for 0.5 seconds at a time waiting for the end
of the experiment, and then each loop it will also check without blocking if
there was an abort or restart.

summary.raw:
Remove timeout on polling second queue during experiment. Now, during an
experiment the loop will block for 0.5 seconds at a time waiting for the end
of the experiment, and then each loop it will also check without blocking if
there was an abort or restart.

Remove timeout on polling second queue during experiment. Now, during an

there was an abort or restart.

message.raw:
Break out of loop as soon as experiment finished detected, without
checking for aborts (the experiment is already over!). This speeds up
queue processing by about 0.5 seconds per shot.
message.html:
Break out of loop as soon as experiment finished detected, without
checking for aborts (the experiment is already over!). This speeds up
queue processing by about 0.5 seconds per shot.

message.raw:
Queue bugfix: variable 'result' not initialised before used
in while loop predicate.

Incidentally a variable with the same name is used earlier (and
I don't believe that code ever sets is to 'done'), which means
this code works most of the time. But that's obivously not ideal.

(I got variable used before assignment when running a shot with no devices -
obviously not a realistic situation but worth fixing anyway)

message.raw:
Added a theming plugin which allows you to customise the global qt stylesheets

As part of this I made a small backwards compatible change to the plugin API.
I also added a button to the preferences menu which appends example code for turning digital output buttons green.
message.html:
Added a theming plugin which allows you to customise the global qt stylesheets

As part of this I made a small backwards compatible change to the plugin API.
I also added a button to the preferences menu which appends example code for turning digital output buttons green.

Added a theming plugin which allows you to customise the global qt stylesheets

As part of this I made a small backwards compatible change to the plugin API.
I also added a button to the preferences menu which appends example code for turning digital output buttons green.

values.message: Merge

message.raw:
Improved plugin system

* Added reference to queue manager
* Fixed GUI when displaying multiple notifications
* Gave plugins the option of running the callbacks associated with showing/hiding/closing notifications when the notification was programatically hidden/shown/closed
* Fixed bug in connection_table plugin which prevented the filewatcher from being updated with new paths to watch until BLACS was restarted
message.html:
Improved plugin system

  • Added reference to queue manager
  • Fixed GUI when displaying multiple notifications
  • Gave plugins the option of running the callbacks associated with showing/hiding/closing notifications when the notification was programatically hidden/shown/closed
  • Fixed bug in connection_table plugin which prevented the filewatcher from being updated with new paths to watch until BLACS was restarted

summary.raw:
Improved plugin system

* Added reference to queue manager
* Fixed GUI when displaying multiple notifications
* Gave plugins the option of running the callbacks associated with showing/hiding/closing notifications when the notification was programatically hidden/shown/closed
* Fixed bug in connection_table plugin which prevented the filewatcher from being updated with new paths to watch until BLACS was restarted

message.raw:
Expanded ConnectionTable classes

 * Now made it simpler to add columns to the connection table while maintaining backwards compatibility by introducing a wrapping class to the HDF5 row. This wrapping class returns default values if the column does not exist in the connection table.
 * Added support for a "properties" column which will be a dictionary containing properties of the device that should be compared when checking for a valid subset.
message.html:
Expanded ConnectionTable classes

  • Now made it simpler to add columns to the connection table while maintaining backwards compatibility by introducing a wrapping class to the HDF5 row. This wrapping class returns default values if the column does not exist in the connection table.
  • Added support for a "properties" column which will be a dictionary containing properties of the device that should be compared when checking for a valid subset.

in the event that BLACS is restarting. This may resolve a possible race condition.

message.raw:
Renamed icon to lower case.

I did this earlier (just by renaming the file) but mercurial didn't pick
up on it because windows filenames are not case sensitive.

However windows *is* case sensitive enough that it couldn't find the icon file
later when I set it on a shortcut with the new name. Silly....

Also removed a pointless printline

message.raw:
Added overrideable method for getting the device for a child channel from the connection table.
This allows devices with internal IntermediateDevices (like the PulseBlaster) to override the default behaviour and search a child device for a specific channel. See the implementation in labscript_devices/PulseBlaster.py PulseBlasterTab class.

Added overrideable method for getting the device for a child channel from the connection table.
This allows devices with internal IntermediateDevices (like the PulseBlaster) to override the default behaviour and search a child device for a specific channel. See the implementation in labscript_devices/PulseBlaster.py PulseBlasterTab class.

message.raw:
Modified worker initialisation to always run the worker's init method first

We now manually insert the state that will run Tab._initialise_worker at the start of the queue. Any states queued up before this are thus bumped further down the queue.

Note that while the mainloop is started immediatedly in Tab.__init__ it cannot get an item out of the queue until control is returned to the Qt Event loop and the Qt Event is processed to check for items in the queue (which doesn't happen until after the worker processes are created by DeviceTab.__init__ )
message.html:
Modified worker initialisation to always run the worker's init method first

We now manually insert the state that will run Tab._initialise_worker at the start of the queue. Any states queued up before this are thus bumped further down the queue.

Note that while the mainloop is started immediatedly in Tab.init it cannot get an item out of the queue until control is returned to the Qt Event loop and the Qt Event is processed to check for items in the queue (which doesn't happen until after the worker processes are created by DeviceTab.init )

message.raw:
Fixed race condition in accessing self.last_requested_state

This probably didn't affect much, but had at least a small probability of raising an exception. The exception occurred when Python switched threads half-way through evaulating "if self.last_requested_state is not None and allowed_states&self.last_requested_state:" which raised an exception if self.last_requested_state was None and "&"'d with an int.

message.raw:
Fixed issue where a h5py error was logged on shutdown despite it actually being totally fine (I was expecting the error, and cauight it appropriately).
This was introduced by changeset 9ca6ebbb54be where we added code to explicitly log an exception.

Instead or deleting the connection table and thent rying to load the connection table (of course this would raise an error!), I've added a flag to FrontPanelSettings.save_front_to_h5() which forces the connection table to be overwritten.

As we've changed the API, we've bumped the minor version to 1.2.0

Fixed bug where missing labscriptlib group in h5 file prevented shot from being repeated.
We now check for existence of group in original h5 file before copying to new h5 file.

Bumped patch version to 1.1.2-dev

Added support for new labscript PulseBlaster classes PulseBlaster_No_DDS and PulseBlasterUSB.
These classes require Python spinapi v1.1.0 or newer.
Bumped minor version number to 1.1.0.
Note: branch named 1.1.0-dev is incorrectly named and will be released later with a higher minor version number.

message.raw:
Fixed bug where an experiment with no digital outputs on the NI_pcie_6363 device would not work correctly
(analog outputs would not update and it would sometmies raise an exception)

Solution is to make sure you stop the DO task first, to free up the PFI for clock input. For smoe reason it was OK doing this last if you were immediately creating a new DO task, but if you were just stopping the DO task (and not configuring it for a buffered sequence) then it failed.

updated __version__ attribute to be consistent with semver

message.raw:
Included support for running BLACS under PyQt or PySide.
Updated license file.

BLACS launches with PyQt by default. To launch with PySide, run "python main.pyw pyside"

Requires qtutils 1.2.0 and labscript_utils 1.1.0 or newer (versions of these packages are checked on startup)

message.raw:
Fixed bugs caused by incorrect paths.

* the path to main.ui was relative to the directory python was started in. Thus BLACS would fail to start unless you were within the blacs folder
* the BLACS log path was fixed to C:\pythonlib\BLACS\BLACS.log. BLACS would fail to start if it was installed anywhere else.

  • the BLACS log path was fixed to C:\pythonlib\BLACS\BLACS.log. BLACS would fail to start if it was installed anywhere else.

* the path to main.ui was relative to the directory python was started in. Thus BLACS would fail to start unless you were within the blacs folder

message.raw:
Fixed bug in exception handling of connection table compilation code.

When compiling a new connection table, an OSError is raised if the file is open in another process. In this case we had not updated the exception handling code to use the new OutputBox protocol used by the zprocess module. This is now fixed.
fixes #1
bumped patch version to 1.0.5

When compiling a new connection table, an OSError is raised if the file is open in another process. In this case we had not updated the exception handling code to use the new OutputBox protocol used by the zprocess module. This is now fixed.
